items.title: ‘Toughest test’: Iran urges firm UN action to end genocide in Gaza
items.summary: Iranian Foreign Ministry spokesman Esmaeil Baghaei says the United Nations must urgently put an end to the Israeli regime’s ongoing genocide in the Gaza Strip. Baghaei posted the message on X on Monday, as he arrived in New York as part of an Iranian delegation for the 80th annual session of the United Nations General Assembly.

items.title: IRGC, Army chiefs vow unified response to slightest aggression
items.summary: Iran’s top military commanders have vowed that any act of aggression against the country will be met with “a unified, swift, intelligent, and powerful response” from the combined forces of the Army and the Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC). Iranian Army’s chief Major General Amir Hatami and IRGC Chief Major General Mohammad Pakpour met and held talks on the occasion of Sacred Defense Week that commemorates the anniversary of the Iraq-imposed war on Iran in the 1980s.

items.title: Iran’s top general vows ‘strategic surprises’ against 'bullying' powers
items.summary: Iran’s top military official has warned that the country’s Armed Forces will unleash “strategic surprises” to deliver a timely and crushing response to any threat from bullying and oppressive powers. Chief of Staff of the Iranian Armed Forces, Major General Abdolrahim Mousavi, made the remark in a message to commemorate the Sacred Defense Week, which marks an eight-year war of aggression imposed on Iran by then-Iraqi dictator Saddam Hussein in the 1980s.

items.title: Iran, Russia to sign deals on building new nuclear power plants: Nuclear chief
items.summary: The head of the Atomic Energy Organization of Iran says Tehran and Moscow will sign agreements, during his visit to Russia, on the construction of more nuclear power plants in the country. Mohammad Eslami arrived in the Russian capital on Monday at the head of a delegation to hold meetings with the country’s officials and take part in events, which will be held on the occasion of the World Atomic Week in Moscow from September 25 to 29.

items.title: From 1980 to 2025: West-backed imposed wars against Iran end same way – in defeat
items.summary:
By Ivan Kesic

Today marks the forty-fifth anniversary of the outbreak of the Imposed War, an eight-year war of aggression launched by Saddam Hussein's Ba'athist regime against the Islamic Republic of Iran that would become one of the longest conventional wars of the twentieth century. The invasion, launched on September 21, 1980, represented a profound test for the nascent Islamic Republic, which was still consolidating its revolutionary gains and faced significant internal challenges.

items.title: Italy disrupted as protests over Gaza genocide sweep through cities
items.summary: Several cities across Italy saw pro-Palestinian protests, strikes, and blockades, following union calls to "denounce the genocide in Gaza" and demand diplomatic and economic sanctions against Israel. Workers across Italy launched a nationwide strike on Monday, halting public transport, rail services, schools, public offices, and ports in more than 60 cities.

items.title: UK recognition of Palestine meant to cover up complicity in Gaza genocide: Advocacy group
items.summary: UK advocacy group CAGE International says London’s ​​​​​​long-overdue recognition of the Palestinian state is an attempt to whitewash Britain’s historical complicity in Israel’s ongoing genocide in Gaza. "The UK government’s recognition of Palestine comes 77 years too late, without any accountability for Britain’s own role in establishing the Israeli settler-colonial entity,” said Anas Mustapha, Head of Public Advocacy at CAGE, referencing the 1917 Balfour Declaration, which paved the way for the establishment of Israel in 1948.

items.title: French town halls raise Palestinian flag in defiance of govt. warning
items.summary: In defiance of an interior ministry warning, almost two dozen town halls in France have raised the Palestinian flag from their entrances ahead of President Emmanuel Macron's much-expected recognition of the Palestinian state. The French president is set to declare recognition of the Palestinian state in New York on the sidelines of the United Nations General Assembly, fulfilling a promise he made in the summer that caused displeasure in Israel.

items.title: Iran expects China to implement global governance initiative in practice: Pezeshkian
items.summary: Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian says the Islamic Republic expects China to do more to implement its “valuable” initiative regarding global governance to promote multilateralism and counter unilateralism. Pezeshkian made the remarks in a recent interview with China Central Television (CCTV) during his visit to Beijing, where he attended the 25th Shanghai Cooperation Organization summit.

items.title: Bahrainis commemorate martyred Hezbollah leaders Nasrallah, Safieddine
items.summary: On the occasion of the first martyrdom anniversary of the late secretary generals of the Lebanese Hezbollah resistance movement, Sayyed Hassan Nasrallah and Sayyed Hashem Safieddine, dozens of Bahraini demonstrators have participated in a rally to pay tributes to the two exemplary figures. The marchers took to the streets in the northern village of Karrana on Sunday evening to honor the memory of the late Hezbollah leaders.

items.title: Israeli drone strike kills five, including three children, in southern Lebanon
items.summary: At least five people, including three children, were killed and two others wounded in an Israeli drone strike on southern Lebanon, the latest breach of the November 2024 ceasefire by the occupying regime. Lebanese media outlets reported that an Israeli drone fired two guided missiles on Sunday afternoon, one targeting a motorcycle and another hitting a nearby car carrying a family of six in the southern Lebanese town of Bint Jbeil.

items.title: Leader congratulates Iran's Greco-Roman wrestling team on winning world title
items.summary: Leader of the Islamic Revolution Ayatollah Seyyed Ali Khamenei has congratulated Iran’s Greco-Roman wrestling team for securing the world championship title at the 2025 World Wrestling Championships in Croatia. In a message on Sunday, Ayatollah Khamenei lauded the “determination and hard work” of the wrestlers for bringing joy and pride to the nation.

items.title: Displaced Palestinians flee southwards, as Israel presses on with Gaza City operation
items.summary: Palestinians headed southward along a coastal road in central Gaza on Monday , with belongings loaded onto vehicles, as Israel's military operation continued in Gaza City. Israeli forces blew up more residential buildings in Gaza City on Sunday, killing at least 31 Palestinians and prompting many others to flee, Gazan health authorities said, as Israel's tanks pushed further into the densely populated city.

items.title: Thousands take to streets in Philippines over flood control fraud
items.summary: Thousands of people gathered at a public park in Manila on Sunday, September 21, in a mass protest against the perceived corruption over the government's infrastructure projects. Allegations of mismanagement of the government's flood control projects have been in the spotlight in recent months during the country's monsoon season, which has inundated towns and cities despite spending over 545 billion pesos ($9.

items.title: Protesters throw paint at Israeli embassy in Mexico, urge government to sever ties
items.summary: Protesters aimed balloons filled with paint at the Israeli embassy in Mexico on Saturday during a rally in support of the Palestinian people. Police were on hand to cordon off the embassy in Mexico City, and the paint balloons did not reach the actual building.

items.title: Canadians protest PM Carney on migrants, climate, Palestine, indigenous rights
items.summary: About 2,000 activists rallied and marched in Toronto in nationwide protests against Prime Minister Mark Carney’s policies on climate, the war in Gaza, and migrants’ and indigenous rights. Protesters on Saturday criticized Bill C-5, the One Canadian Economy Act, passed in June, which fast-tracks major infrastructure projects deemed in the national interest.

items.title: Europe wide cyberattack causes delay at Berlin airport
items.summary: Travelers crowded Brussels' international airport after a cyberattack at a service provider for check-in and boarding systems disrupted operations at several major European airports on Saturday (September 20). The attack has rendered automated systems inoperable, allowing only manual check-in and boarding procedures, Brussels Airport said.

items.title: Palestinians search for survivors after Israeli strike on Gaza City
items.summary: Rescue teams and residents search for survivors and casualties under the rubble of a building hit by an Israeli air strike in the al-Shati refugee camp, west of Gaza City. "We, the people of Gaza, we want to live, we don't want to die.

items.title: Anti-Trump protesters gather in London against his state visit
items.summary: Armed with signs and shouting slogans, thousands of anti-Donald Trump protesters descended Wednesday on central London to decry the US president's unprecedented second state visit to the UK. London's Metropolitan Police estimated that there were around 5,000 people at the protest.

items.title: Nepal mourns people killed during anti-corruption protests
items.summary: Nepal flies flags at half-mast during a national day of mourning for the 73 people killed during youth-led anti-corruption protests that toppled the government. An interim government, which took over after two days of protests last week, declared the day of mourning "in honor of those who lost their lives during the protests", the Ministry of Home Affairs said in a statement.

items.title: Explainer: Why Iran's gas turbine export to Russia marks strategic shift in energy tech trade
items.summary:
By Ivan Kesic

Iran has reached a significant milestone in its technological advancement by exporting an advanced MGT-70 gas turbine to Russia, marking the first time the country has supplied such sophisticated power generation equipment to Moscow. The deal represents a strategic breakthrough for Iran’s MAPNA Group, which developed the turbine through years of domestic engineering despite Western sanctions.

items.title: After historic safety net cuts, Trump administration cancels hunger report
items.summary: The Trump administration has scrapped the federal government’s annual food insecurity report, dismissing it as “redundant” and “politicized,” after enacting sweeping cuts to the food stamp program. The Wall Street Journal first reported the end of the report.

items.title: Over 360 Gaza medical workers abducted, held in Israeli prisons: Rights group
items.summary: A Palestinian prisoners’ advocacy group says Israeli forces have abducted hundreds of Palestinian medical personnel and health workers in Gaza ever since the occupying Tel Aviv regime unleashed its genocidal campaign in the besieged territory in October 2023. According to the Palestine Center for Prisoners Studies, Israeli forces have kidnapped over 360 healthcare workers, four of whom have died in custody due to torture and medical neglect.

items.title: Poll: 50% of Dutch electorate say Gaza genocide to affect their vote
items.summary: Almost half of the people in the Netherlands say the Israeli regime’s ongoing genocide in Gaza, which has been receiving unprecedentedly generous arms support from the West, will affect the way they will vote in the upcoming elections. The percentage, reported across Dutch media outlets on Monday, came out of a poll, which had been commissioned by various human rights organizations and conducted by Motivaction International, a research body.

items.title: UEFA set to vote on Israel's suspension from all competitions amid Gaza genocide
items.summary: Israel is facing the risk of being suspended from all European football competitions following growing pressure on the sporting body due to the Tel Aviv regime’s relentless genocidal war on the besieged Gaza Strip. Israel’s Channel 12 reported that the Union of European Football Associations executive committee was expected to discuss whether to suspend the Israeli team and club sides from all European competitions.

items.title: Explainer: How Russia and China could delay or obstruct Iran ‘snapback’ sanctions
items.summary:
By Press TV Website Staff

The UN Security Council on Friday voted down a resolution that sought to permanently lift sanctions on Iran, effectively clearing the way for snapback sanctions to move forward against the Islamic Republic of Iran. The development came well in advance of the September 28 deadline for the automatic reactivation of the sanctions under the so-called “snapback” mechanism embedded in the 2015 nuclear accord, known formally as the Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action (JCPOA).

items.title: Freed Israeli captive announces return to army to resume role in Gaza genocide
items.summary: A former Israeli-American captive has announced that he will rejoin the Israeli army to take part in the regime’s ongoing genocidal war in Gaza, which has already claimed tens of thousands of innocent lives. Edan Alexander, a dual US-Israeli citizen who was released by the Gaza-based Hamas resistance group in May, declared that “serving the regime’s military is one of the greatest honors of my life” during a so-called Friends of the Israel Defense Forces (FIDF) event in the United States earlier this week.

items.title: Pentagon restricts media access, threatens journalists over reporting
items.summary: The Pentagon has imposed sweeping restrictions on media, requiring journalists to pledge that they will not collect or report any information, even unclassified documents, without formal clearance. On Thursday, Pentagon announced that the Department of War (DoW), recently re-branded from the Department of Defense (DoD) under the Trump administration requires that all "information must be approved for public release by an appropriate authorizing official before it is released, even if it is unclassified.

items.title: EU divided over Russia sanctions package
items.summary: NATO deployed three French fighter jets to Eastern Poland on Friday as a so-called deterrent against Russia. Many analysts argue that it is the Western Alliance's expansion that sparked the conflict in Ukraine.

items.summary:
By Humaira Ahad

Isfahan’s cuisine reflects centuries of culture, blending spices, stories, and traditions into immersive culinary experiences for travelers. Tourists engage deeply through cooking workshops, market tours, and heritage dishes that connect them to Iran’s living food traditions.

items.title: Recognize Palestine to stop Gaza genocide: Ex-New Zealand PM to world leaders
items.summary: Former New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern has called on world leader to put an end to the ongoing genocide of Palestinians in the Gaza Strip by recognizing Palestinian statehood. In an opinion piece published by The Guardian on Friday, the former prime minister decried the massive death toll in Gaza, in particular the impact of the genocidal war on new mothers and childbirth.

items.title: French Interior Ministry clamps down on public display of Palestinian flags
items.summary: France’s Interior Ministry has instructed prefects across the country to block the display of Palestinian flags on municipal buildings and other public structures next week, coinciding with Paris’s official recognition of the Palestinian state. In a telegram sent on Thursday, the ministry asserted the principle of public service neutrality “prohibits such flag displays,” alleging that they would amount to “taking sides in an international conflict,” which falls under the exclusive authority of the state.

items.title: Isfahan: Where Iran’s rich history, culture, and industry unite

items.title: Israel occupying more Syrian territory under the pretext of supporting the Druze: ‌Expert
items.summary: Speaking to Press TV, Naji Chenani, an expert on West Asia affairs, stated that Israel is using the Druze community in Syria as a pretext to advance its agenda in the Arab country.

items.title: Iran will suspend cooperation with IAEA: Top security body
items.summary: Iran’s Supreme National Security Council (SNSC) says Tehran will suspend its cooperation with the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) after the United Nations Security Council voted not to permanently lift sanctions on Tehran. In a statement on Saturday, Iran’s top security body condemned the “ill-considered” moves by Britain, France, and Germany —known as the E3— regarding the Islamic Republic’s peaceful nuclear program.

items.title: Iran wins Greco-Roman wrestling world championship after 11 years
items.summary: Iran’s Greco-Roman wrestling team has won the championship title at the 2025 Wrestling World Championships in Croatia, securing victory ahead of schedule with an impressive medal tally. Amin Mirzazadeh and Gholamreza Farrokhi, competing in the 130 kg and 82 kg weight categories, respectively, delivered outstanding performances, securing two gold medals for their team.

items.title: Iran warns it will terminate IAEA deal if UN sanctions are reimposed
items.summary: A senior Iranian diplomat has stated that the recent Tehran-IAEA agreement reached in Cairo will be terminated if the UN sanctions are reinstated or the so-called snapback mechanism is triggered. Deputy Foreign Minister Kazem Gharibabadi made the remarks in a phone conversation with IRIB News in response to Europe’s move to reinstate the UN Security Council resolutions, despite Iran’s maximum cooperation with the European Troika and the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) in recent days.

items.title: ‘You cannot even take back a single vessel’: Yemen dismisses Israeli threats to occupy Sana’a
items.summary: Yemen’s Ansarullah resistance movement has categorically dismissed the latest Israeli threats to assassinate its leader, Abdul-Malik al-Houthi, and raise the regime’s flag over the Arab country’s capital of Sana’a. “You talk about the occupation of Sana’a, whilst you cannot take back a single vessel,” Mohammed al-Farah, a member of the Ansarullah political bureau, said late on Friday in reaction to Israeli minister of military affairs Israel Katz’s threats.

items.title: Lasting peace in West Asia cannot be achieved without just solution to Palestinian issue: Russia
items.summary: The Russian Ministry of Foreign Affairs says lasting and genuine peace in West Asia cannot be achieved without a just and comprehensive solution to the Palestinian issue, emphasizing that the settlement of the decades-long conflict remains the cornerstone for achieving stability in the region. Speaking at a press conference in the Russian capital of Moscow on Friday, the ministry’s spokeswoman, Maria Zakharova, said justice in the question of Palestine is the foundation of any sustainable peace agreement in West Asia.

items.title: Brazil formally joins South Africa’s genocide case against Israel at ICJ
items.summary: Brazil has formally filed a declaration of intervention at the International Court of Justice (ICJ) in the case lodged by South Africa against the Israeli regime over its October 2023-present war of genocide on the Gaza Strip. On Friday, The Hague-based tribunal confirmed that Brasilia had lodged the declaration at the court’s registry on September 17, invoking Article 63 of the court’s Statute.

items.title: US senators introduce resolution calling for recognition of Palestinian state
items.summary:
A group of US Democratic senators is leading a call to recognize the Palestinian state, describing it as “the only viable path” to prevent future generations from enduring “insecurity and affliction. ”

Senator Jeff Merkley of Oregon introduced the nonbinding resolution on Thursday, urging the United States to formally recognize a “demilitarized Palestinian state.

items.title: Iran-Pakistan economic realignment alongside China’s rise
items.summary: The 22nd Joint Economic Commission (JEC) between Iran and Pakistan, held in Tehran earlier this week, signaled a notable recalibration of economic strategy between the two neighbors. The meeting highlighted the substantial economic potential that remains largely untapped despite decades of diplomatic and trade relations.

items.title: Estonia accuses Russia of airspace violation; Moscow denies
items.summary: Estonia has accused Russia of violating its airspace, claiming three supersonic fighter jets carried out an “unprecedented and brazen” incursion, while Moscow rejected the allegation, insisting its aircraft stayed over neutral Baltic waters during a routine flight. Estonia said on Friday that three Russian MiG-31 jets entered its territory for 12 minutes, adding that the alleged airspace violation occurred in the area of Vaindloo Island, around 100 kilometers from the capital Tallinn.

items.title: Egypt’s initiative for anti-Israel Arab alliance rejected at Doha summit
items.summary: Egypt’s proposal to establish a “NATO-style” military alliance in the face of “external threats, particularly Israel,” was rejected at a summit of Arab and Islamic nations in Doha last week, a report said. During an emergency summit of Arab and Islamic leaders held in the Qatari capital Doha in mid-September, Egyptian President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi proposed creating “a rapid-response alliance to shield member states from external threats, particularly Israel," the Middle East Eye reported Saturday.

items.title: IRGC warns US, Israel of ‘deadly’ response to any new aggression
items.summary: The Islamic Revolution Guards Corps (IRGC) has warned the enemies, particularly the United States and Israel, that any miscalculation or new act of aggression against Iran will be met with a “deadly” response. "In the event of any new miscalculation or aggression by the enemy, the Islamic Republic of Iran will take the initiative on the battlefield with a commanding position and deliver another deadly response,” the IRGC said Sunday, marking the start of Sacred Defense Week that commemorates the anniversary of the Iraq-imposed war on Iran in the 1980s.

items.title: Trump’s net approval rating reaches near all-time low
items.summary:

items.title: Cyberattack disrupts services at major European airports
items.summary: Shafaqna English- A cyberattack on a third-party service provider has caused significant flight disruptions at major European airports, including Heathrow in London, Brussels, and Berlin, authorities reported on Saturday (20 Sep 2025). Brussels Airport confirmed at least four flight cancellations on Saturday morning, including departures to Rwanda and Amsterdam, following the Friday night attack, which knocked out automated check-in and boarding systems.

items.title: Commentary on the Quran (Chapter 3:104)

Commentary on the Quran (Chapter 3:104)

By: Mohammad Sobhanie

Calling for Truth and Fighting Corruption

بِسْمِ اللَّـهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ

وَلْتَكُن مِّنكُمْ أُمَّةٌ يَدْعُونَ إِلَى الْخَيْرِ وَيَأْمُرُونَ بِالْمَعْرُوفِ وَيَنْهَوْنَ عَنِ الْمُنكَرِ ۚ وَأُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الْمُفْلِحُونَ ‎﴿١٠٤﴾‏‏

3:104 And let there be (arising) from you a nation inviting to (all that is) good, enjoining what is right and forbidding what is wrong, and those will be the successful. items.title: New research lead to detect & eliminate dormant breast cancer cells
items.summary: Shafaqna English– Scientists at the University of Pennsylvania have developed a pioneering strategy to detect and eliminate dormant breast cancer cells—a major cause of recurrence—using repurposed existing drugs. In a federally funded clinical trial, the approach successfully cleared these “sleeper cells” in 80% of participants, achieving a 100% three-year survival rate without recurrence in patients receiving combination therapy.

By Alireza Hashemi

The recent Israeli-American aggression against Iran backfired by strengthening national unity and shifting international public opinion in Iran’s favor, according to an analyst. In an interview with the Press TV website, Mohsen Pakaeen, a former Iranian diplomat and international relations expert, said the unprovoked aggression, rather than weakening Iran, has galvanized its people and enhanced the country’s standing on the global stage.

items.title: Red light for Israel: How genocide in Gaza sparked historic Eurovision boycott
items.summary:
By Humaira Ahad

The Eurovision Song Contest, Europe’s most-watched cultural event, is heading into what experts call an “existential” crisis. With nearly eight months to go before the 70th edition takes place in Vienna, the contest is overshadowed by growing calls to exclude Israel over its genocidal war on Gaza, where nearly 66,000 Palestinians have been killed since October 2023.

items.title: Isfahan, half of the world
items.summary: Isfahan has long been a city of superlatives, once the dazzling capital of the Persian Empire, it has been praised in poetry, painted in manuscripts, and remembered by travelers as one of the most beautiful cities in the world. Its domes shimmer with turquoise and gold, its boulevards stretch beneath ancient plane trees, and its squares still throng with the life of centuries past.

items.title: Review: The Voice of Hind Rajab – searing testimony to genocide through 6-year-old’s voice
items.summary:
By Sheida Eslami

In a tumultuous world where the boundaries between news, art, and social activism grow thinner each day, The Voice of Hind Rajab stands as an audiovisual document at the frontline of this convergence. The haunting story of the slain six-year-old Palestinian girl Hind Rajab begins with a brief phone call in January 2024, made from the besieged Tel al-Hawa neighborhood of Gaza, where gunfire and the roar of armored vehicles drowned out every sound.

items.title: Discover Iran: New Julfa, Isfahan’s Armenian quarter that blends faith, trade and culture
items.summary:
By Maryam Qarehgozlou

Founded in 1606, New Julfa in Isfahan city became a thriving Armenian quarter, blending Persian traditions, Christian faith, and flourishing trade. Armenian merchants connected Isfahan to global commerce, exporting silk and importing silver, spices, and luxury goods across continents.

items.title: Discover Iran: Isfahan’s timeless musical legacy lives on through Bayat-e Isfahan
items.summary:
By Humaira Ahad

Isfahan’s Bayat-e Isfahan mode, romantic and continuous, forms the emotional core of Persian classical music tradition. The city’s music reflects centuries of cultural devotion, blending courtly life, regional melodies, and artistic storytelling techniques.

items.title: ‘The Voice of Hind Rajab’: Docudrama on slain Gaza girl stuns Venice, resonates globally
items.summary:
By Humaira Ahad

“I am so scared, please come. Please call someone to come and take me.

items.title: Week of Islamic unity in Iran: 15,00th birth anniv. of Prophet Muhammad
items.summary: It's one of the simplest yet most powerful words in the Islamic world, unity. And every year for one week Iran marks it in a very special way, from the 12th to the 17th of Rabi' al-Awwal on the Islamic calendar, the days between two dates claimed as the birth date of the Prophet Muhammad.

items.title: 1,500 years of light: Prophet Muhammad's life, mission in two cinematic masterpieces
items.summary:
By Humaira Ahad

Stars fall from the heavens, the universe seems to rejoice, and divine signs appear across the holy city of Mecca. Even before his blessed birth, extraordinary events signal his destined greatness.

items.title: Revisiting calls for Muslim unity on Prophet Muhammad’s 1,500th birth anniversary
items.summary:
By Humaira Ahad

Tehran appears particularly vibrant these days, alive with a sense of togetherness, as Iranians prepare to mark the 1,500th birth anniversary of Prophet Muhammad (PBUH). Across the capital city, banners stretch over streets and squares, expressing devotion to the Holy Prophet (PBUH) and carrying messages of Shia-Sunni unity.

items.title: Iran's Armed Forces condemn Ecuador’s ‘unlawful’ blacklisting of IRGC
items.summary: The General Staff of Iran’s Armed Forces has strongly condemned the Ecuadorian government's “despicable and unlawful” decision to designate the Islamic Revolution Guards Corps (IRGC) as a terrorist organization. In a statement on Saturday, the General Staff of the Armed Forces said that "the irrational, desperate, and illegal" decision of the Ecuadorian government is in line with serving the global hegemonic system led by the terrorist-sponsoring United States and the fake Zionist regime.

items.title: 'Nonsense': Iran blasts US criticism of its missile program
items.summary: Iran has dismissed as "nonsense" the American criticism of its missile development, describing the program as a shield against the US and Israeli aggression. "He was speaking nonsense," Iranian Foreign Ministry spokesman Esmaeil Baghaei told journalists on Wednesday, referring to recent remarks by US Secretary of State Marco Rubio.

items.title: Top general: Combat readiness deterring fresh enemy attack on Iran
items.summary: Chief of Staff of the Iranian Armed Forces Major General Abdolrahim Mousavi has expressed satisfaction with the increasing defensive deterrent power, emphasizing that Iran’s combat readiness has prevented enemies from conducting a new round of strikes against the country. “Our defensive and combat preparedness has reached a stage that prevents enemies from committing miscalculations, including the notion of ​​launching a fresh invasion of our country,” Mousavi said on Wednesday as he was paying a visit to the tactical headquarters of the Islamic Revolution Guard Corps (IRGC) Ground Force in Tehran.

items.title: Armed assailants kill two police officers in southeast Iran
items.summary: Armed assailants have attacked a police vehicle in Sistan and Baluchestan Province in southeastern Iran, killing two officers and wounding another. The attack took place on the highway linking the province’s city of Khash and the provincial capital Zahedan on Tuesday, Sistan and Baluchestan’s Police Information Center reported.

items.title: Israel will get Iran’s ‘firm response’ if it puts foot wrong: Official
items.summary: An Iranian official has praised the country’s defense capabilities, warning Israel of a crushing response if it puts a foot wrong. Ramezan Sharif, head of the headquarters commemorating the Palestinian Intifada and International Quds Day, made the remarks on Sunday.

items.title: Iranian court sentences four to death over spying for Israel's Mossad
items.summary: Four individuals have been sentenced to death by a revolutionary court in northwestern Iran for collaborating with the Israeli Mossad spy agency and sharing classified and sensitive information with the occupying Tel Aviv regime in exchange for money. The chief justice of Iran's West Azarbaijan province, Nasser Atabati, said in a statement on Thursday that the defendants were convicted of taking pictures of and filming sensitive centers across the country, and relaying sensitive information to the Zionist regime’s intelligence officials.

items.title: Multi-national projects in Chabahar undeterred by US sanctions: Iran
items.summary: Iran says its joint development projects with India and other countries in the deepwater port of Chabahar will continue regardless of a recent decision by the United States to withdraw a sanctions waiver granted to the port seven years ago. Iranian Foreign Ministry’s Director General of South Asia Department said on Sunday that a US announcement earlier this week that it would end the sanctions waiver granted to Chabahar is an illegal attempt to prevent other countries from contributing to development works in the port.

items.title: Iran’s domestic meat supply up 28% y/y in August
items.summary: The domestic production of red meat has increased by nearly a third in Iran in the calendar month to late August compared to the same month last year. Figures by Iran’s official statistics agency (SCI) released on Saturday showed that the domestic supply of meat had reached 42,335 metric tons (mt) in the month to August 22, up 28% from the same period last year.

items.title: Iran’s iron, steel exports up 10% y/y in Apr-Aug to nearly $3bn
items.summary: Iran has reported an increase in its steel exports after a sluggish start to the calendar year that began in late March. Figures by the Iranian Steel Producers Association (ISPA) released on Saturday showed that Iranian steelmakers had exported some $2.

items.title: US drops waiver for Iran’s Chabahar port, hitting India’s investment
items.summary: The United States has revoked the sanctions waiver for Iran’s Chabahar port, threatening India’s multi-million-dollar investment in the strategic project amid straining ties between Washington and New Delhi. The White House announced on Thursday that the exemption, in place since 2018, will end on September 29.

items.title: Iran reports significant fall in exports to Iraq
items.summary: Iran has reported a significant fall in its exports to Iraq amid lower volumes of natural gas being delivered to the neighboring country. The chairman of Iran-Iraq Joint Chamber of Commerce said on Tuesday that Iran’s exports to Iraq had declined by 18% year on year in the five months to August 22 to reach $3.

items.title: US issues new Iran-related sanctions, targeting alleged financial network
items.summary: The United States has announced new Iran-related sanctions, targeting what it has described as a network of “shadow banking” that has facilitated financial transactions resulting from Iran’s oil sales and other activities. The US Department of the Treasury said in a statement on its website on Tuesday that it had designated four Iranian nationals and a dozen companies in Hong Kong and the United Arab Emirates (UAE) for their roles in funds transfers benefiting Iran.

items.title: RoboLegal heralds expansion of Iran’s tech ecosystem
items.summary: Iran has taken a big step forward by introducing its first AI-powered legal robot called “RoboLegal”, using smart technology to improve everyday services for its citizens. This new technology is designed to help people get legal advice easily and quickly, allowing individuals with varying levels of legal knowledge to interact via voice or text.

items.title: Iran’s dairy exports up 32% y/y in June quarter
items.summary: Iran has reported a major surge in its exports of dairy products in the first quarter of the calendar year that started in late March. A Monday report by Tasnim news agency showed that Iran had exported $280.

items.title: China to supply 7 GW of solar panels to Iran: Report
items.summary: China will supply a large consignment of solar panels to Iran as part of a major economic contract signed between the two countries, according to a report published in the local media. The semi-official Fars news agency said in a Sunday report that Iran’s sovereign wealth fund (NDFI) had committed to payments to China for the supply of 7 gigawatts (GW) of solar panels to the country.

items.title: Top Russian energy officials in Tehran for gas deal talks
items.summary: Russia’s top energy officials have held talks with Iran’s Oil Minister Mohsen Paknejad in Tehran amid reports that the two countries are finalizing pricing issues for a major gas transfer deal that would allow Russia to export sizable volumes of natural gas to Iran. A report by the Iranian Oil Ministry’s news service Shana on Wednesday said that Russia’s Energy Minister Sergey Tsivilyov and CEO of the Russian state gas company Gazprom Alexey Miller had attended meetings with Paknejad earlier in the day in the Ministry’s headquarters in downtown Tehran.

items.title: Iran concerned about security implications of its massive energy demand
items.summary: Iran is concerned about the security implications of its massive energy demand, as a senior Oil Ministry official believes the country should do more to make its energy use efficient. CEO of the National Iranian Gas Company (NIGC) Saeed Tavakoli said on Monday that Iran relies on natural gas for 83% of its electricity generation demand, saying the figure is nearly four times the current international norms.

items.title: Iran reports new record in gasoline consumption
items.summary: Iran has reported a new record in gasoline consumption despite its continued efforts to curb fuel smuggling from the country. A report released on Sunday by the National Iranian Oil Products Distribution Company (NIOPDC) showed that the firm had supplied an average of 143.

items.title: Iran awards gas field contract to its largest steel company
items.summary: Iran’s Oil Ministry has awarded a gas field development contract to its largest steel company amid efforts to use funding resources from metals and petrochemical manufacturers to increase the country’s energy supplies. The contract awarded to Mobarakeh Steel Company (MSC) on Sunday would allow the steel manufacturer to develop the Madar gas field, located 15 kilometers to the east of Asaluyeh, Iran’s main gas production hub on the Persian Gulf coast.

items.title: At 65, OPEC shares resilience and resolve with Iran
items.summary: As the Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) marks its 65th anniversary, it faces a complex global energy landscape far removed from the era of its founding in 1960. Yet despite seismic shifts, including the rise of shale oil, geopolitical tensions, and a global pivot toward renewable, OPEC remains an indispensable pillar in the world’s energy market, underpinned by its dominant oil reserves and the strategic roles of key members such as Iran.

items.title: Iran, Russia will soon finalize price issues on gas deal: Envoy
items.summary: Iran and Russia are planning to hold price negotiations on a major gas supply deal that allows Russia to export sizable volumes of natural gas to Iran, according to remarks by Iran’s ambassador to Moscow. Kazem Jalali said on Monday that a Russian delegation will travel to Iran next week to discuss final aspects of the gas export agreement between the two countries.

items.title: Iranian oil sector’s lesson in resilience and ingenuity
items.summary: Despite an intensification of US sanctions in the past year, Iran’s oil industry has demonstrated remarkable resilience, maintaining and even expanding export volumes amid some of the most intensive restrictions seen since 2018. The latest round of sanctions, unveiled in July 2025, targets key sectors including maritime transportation and insurance, aiming to sever Iran’s oil revenues by constraining tanker movements.

items.title: Electricity available to 99.8% of Iran’s villages: Official
items.summary: Iran’s Energy Ministry has further expanded electricity penetration across the country, as an official says that some 99. 8% of villages in Iran have access to power.

items.title: Game Over Israel
items.summary: Israel is committing a live-streamed genocide, yet Israeli sporting teams and players have not been declared global pariahs — they continue to participate in club and international competitions with the full backing of governing bodies. As men, women and children are bloodied, starved and martyred in Gaza by the Israeli Occupation Forces (IOF), Israeli teams attempt to whitewash their genocide.

items.title: European Union, sovereignty, issue of Palestine
items.summary: In this episode of Face to Face, Fabian Zuleeg, chief executive of the European Policy Center, explains the foreign policy of the European Union and the reaction of this entity to the ongoing genocide in Gaza.

items.title: Ulyanov: US, E3 politicized Iran's nuclear issue
items.summary: In an exclusive interview with Press TV, Russia's top envoy in Vienna, Mikhail Ulyanov, has accused the United States and European powers of harming diplomatic efforts on the Iranian nuclear file, saying they have politicized the issue and consistently take actions that worsen the situation.

items.title: Lebanese MP shares his ideas about resistance's disarmament plan
items.summary: The decision of the Lebanese government to disarm the Hezbollah Resistance Movement continues to be the main focal point in Lebanese media. Hezbollah and allies, including Iran, have insisted that as long as Israeli occupation and aggression continue, there will be no disarmament.

items.title: Hezbollah and US-Israeli Plan ...
items.summary: Lebanon has entered a very critical juncture in his history as Lebanese government has taken a decision to approve the US proposal. Although the US proposal on one hand, with Israel but on the other hand, it puts an ultimatum for the disarmament of the resistance.

items.title: Francesca Albanese: Israel must be sanctioned!
items.summary: UN Special Rapporteur Francesca Albanese was the guest of this episode of Face to Face, where she called for sanctions on Israel over its atrocities in Gaza.

items.title: Resistance fighter Georges Abdallah
items.summary: Georges Ibrahim Abdallah, a Lebanese resistance fighter, has returned to Lebanon after 41 years of imprisonment in France, where he was held on politically motivated charges. Born in 1951 into a Maronite Christian family, Abdallah dedicated his life to Arab nationalist causes and the Palestinian struggle, actively joining the Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine and later co-founding the Lebanese Armed Revolutionary Factions.

items.title: Interview with Sahar Emami
items.summary: This edition of the program is an interview with Sahar Emami, an Iranian news anchor with the IRIB News Network. She became internationally recognized after an Israeli airstrike hit the IRIB HQ in Tehran during a live broadcast on June 16, 2025.

items.title: Interview with Yasemin Acar, German human rights activist
items.summary: This edition of the program is about the Israeli interception of a humanitarian aid ship called the Madleen on June 9, 2025, in international waters as it sailed towards Gaza as part of the Freedom Flotilla Coalition mission. This interview is with Yasemin Acar, a German human rights activist, who was among the 12 people aboard the ship.

items.title: Exclusive: British doctor sheds light on dire humanitarian crisis in Gaza
items.summary:
Press TV’s website can also be accessed at the following alternate addresses:

In this episode, Ahmad al-Najjar, Press TV's correspondent, sits for talks with Dr. Rose in Nasser Hospital, the last standing medical facility in Gaza.

items.title: Insider's view of the country: Historical sites in Najafabad
items.summary: Najafabad was first established by Shah Abbas the Great in the 16th century. That's about 400 years ago, during the Safavid period, and it has many beautiful castles and buildings within.

items.title: Insider's view of the country: Motocross and Domab village in Najafabad
items.summary: One of the most exciting sports in the world today is motocross. And the city of Najafabad has a small track of its own, where local motorcycle enthusiasts gather.

items.title: Insider's view of the Country: Naqsh-e-Jahan Square
items.summary: We are in Naqsh-e Jahan Square, one of the biggest and most beautiful squares in the world. A UNESCO World Heritage Site that must be on your bucket list.

items.title: An insider's view of the country: Isfahan handicrafts
items.summary: Isfahan, the city that Iranians refer to as "half of the world. " If you ever visit Iran, this is going to be your first stop, where you will be spending at least a couple of days.

items.title: Insider's view of the country: Masouleh and Kandovan villages
items.summary: An ancient village dating back to around 1006 AD. Masouleh is mostly famous because there is no vehicular traffic and because of the way it's constructed, where the pathways or roads are on the rooftops of the houses below.

items.title: Insider's view of country: Kharg Island
items.summary: Kharg is the beating heart of Iran's upstream oil sector, and the main hub for the country's crude oil exports. To the eyes of many, Kharg Island is all about pipelines, refineries, huge oil tanks and burning flares.

items.title: Insider's view of country: Qazvin City and pomegranates
items.summary:
This time, we've traveled to one of the beautiful cities of Iran, a place where many compare to Isfahan in terms of its attractions and wonders. Qazvin has a lot to offer, especially to tourists, from historical buildings, caravanserais and traditional bazaars to cuisines, souvenirs and, of course, natural beauties,

And then we will explore a whole pomegranate culture in Iran -- Like 100 pieces of rubies sitting next to each other, as an Iranian poet once described.

items.title: Insider's view of country: Muharram art galleries
items.summary: What happened in Iraq, more specifically in the battle of Karbala all those centuries ago, is so important to humanity that it simply had to be told again and again from one generation to the next in any form or manner possible. This is what artists, narrators, illustrators, and ordinary people have been doing since the noon on that eventful day.

items.title: Iran-1125-An Insider's view of the country: Saadolsaltaneh caravanserai and Wood Inlay
items.summary: It is one of the most vibrant cities in Iran. For centuries, Ghazvin, also known in history as Caspian, has been a melting pot of people and cultures and also one of the important hops for trade and commerce in the region due to its special situation on a part of the Silk Road where merchants brought in commodities from the four corners of the world.

items.title: Lebanon’s dilemma
items.summary: On this edition of The MidEaStream, Marwa Osman speaks with Lebanese MP Paula Yacoubian. At a time of Israeli entity bombardment and escalating threats, Yacoubian stands firmly behind the Nawaf Salam government’s call to place all arms under state authority, a position that raises urgent questions of policy versus peril.

items.title: Retreat and resilience
items.summary: On September 5, Lebanon's cabinet narrowly avoided political self-destruction, as Prime Minister Nawaf Salam's attempt to push Washington's disarmament agenda collapsed under resistance pressure and the national army's refusal to be dragged into civil war. We unpack the fallout of that confrontation, the American reaction it may provoke, and what it means for the balance of power inside Lebanon.

items.title: Gaza: Unbreakable
items.summary: They said Gaza was finished; flattened, cleared, erased from the map. Yet Gaza still breathes, still resists, still writes history with every stone, every tunnel, every heartbeat that refuses to surrender.

items.title: Resistance unbroken
items.summary: In Beirut, the government staged what it called a historic disarmament of Palestinian factions; a pickup truck of old rifles paraded as "progress". But behind this theater lies a dangerous question: is this the first step toward stripping the camps of their real weapons and eventually turning that same gaze toward the Lebanese resistance Hezbollah? Meanwhile in Gaza, hunger has become a weapon of war, with Zionist Israel tightening its grip on a starving population.

items.title: Lebanon’s defining choice
items.summary: Tonight, on The MidEaStream, Marwa Osman speaks with Lebanese MP Najat Aoun Saliba. At a time of Israeli entity bombardment and escalating threats, Saliba stands firmly behind the Nawaf Salam government's call to place all arms under state authority, a position that raises urgent questions of policy versus peril.

items.title: Lebanon's last line
items.summary: As the bombs keep falling and new threats gather on our borders, Beirut hosts a visitor whose words carry weight far beyond diplomacy.

items.title: Lebanon edges disarmament
items.summary: In the shadow of daily Zionist bombardment, Lebanon's cabinet has taken a decision that could change the course of our nation; adopting a US-backed plan to strip the resistance of its arms.

items.title: Genocide, puppets, and power
items.summary: As Gaza bleeds under Western-made bombs, the so-called international community hides behind empty statements and silence. Tonight, we expose the global complicity in a genocide unfolding in real time, while the world watches and does nothing.

items.title: Syria: Risk of partition
items.summary: After years of war and foreign interference, Syria stands at a dangerous crossroads. Its unity is threatened not only by outside powers, but also by insiders who serve foreign agendas.

items.title: Snapback sanctions will create 'new conditions' and void new IAEA deal: Iran
items.summary: Iran warns that any move by Britain, France, and Germany to reinstate UN sanctions through the "snapback mechanism" would create “new conditions” that nullify its recent agreement with the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) signed in Cairo. Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi made the remark on Monday upon arrival in New York at the head of a delegation for the 80th annual session of the United Nations General Assembly.

items.title: Iranian diplomats call snapback ‘politically motivated’, say E3 follows US policies
items.summary: Senior Iranian diplomats have dismissed European efforts to trigger the UN sanctions snapback mechanism as politically motivated and biased, noting that the three European parties to the 2015 nuclear deal are following the US lead. The remarks come as the UN Security Council prepares to vote on whether to reimpose sanctions on Iran that were lifted under the 2015 nuclear deal, formally known as the Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action (JCPOA).

items.title: US threatens countries to block Iran's resolution on protection of nuclear sites
items.summary: Iran’s ambassador to international organizations in Vienna says many member states of the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) are under pressure and threats from the US not to support a draft resolution sponsored by Iran and several other countries at the nuclear watchdog’s General Conference. “A considerable number of IAEA member states, in separate contacts with Iran and other sponsors of the draft resolution, have stated that they are under intense pressure and threats from the United States not to vote in favor of the submitted resolution,” Reza Najafi said Thursday.

items.title: Threats from enemies persist; trust with IAEA must be rebuilt: AEOI chief
items.summary: The head of Iran’s nuclear agency says threats from the Islamic Republic’s adversaries persist since the unprovoked Israeli-American attacks on the country’s nuclear facilities. Mohammad Eslami, who heads the Atomic Energy Organization of Iran (AEOI), made the remarks to Japan’s Kyodo News agency in a written interview that was published on Wednesday.

items.title: Iran urges E3 to act 'responsibly' amid 'snapback' threats
items.summary: Iran’s Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi has called on France, Germany, and Britain, jointly known as the E3, to act “responsibly” and “independently” in the face of mounting pressure to re-impose UN sanctions on the Islamic Republic. In a joint phone call with the E3 counterparts and the EU’s foreign policy chief, the Iranian foreign minister warned that triggering the so-called snapback mechanism would undermine diplomacy and unnecessarily escalate tensions.

items.title: US pressuring countries not to support Iran’s IAEA resolution: Envoy
items.summary: Iran’s ambassador to international organizations in Vienna has accused the United States of exerting political pressure on countries to block support for a resolution prohibiting attacks on peaceful nuclear facilities. The draft, submitted by Iran and five other nations to the 69th General Conference of the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA), calls for a ban on any attack or threat against nuclear sites under the IAEA Safeguards.

items.title: AEOI chief: Israeli-US strikes on Iran nuclear facilities eroded IAEA Safeguards
items.summary: The head of the Atomic Energy Organization of Iran (AEOI) says the June strikes by the Israeli regime and the United States on Iran’s civilian nuclear facilities seriously harmed the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) Safeguards. Addressing the 69th regular session of the General Conference of the International Atomic Energy Agency in Vienna on Monday, Mohammad Eslami said the illegal strikes also threatened the integrity of the global non-proliferation regime.

items.title: Iran nuclear chief in Vienna to push for ban on attacks against nuclear sites
items.summary: The head of the Atomic Energy Organization of Iran (AEOI) says Tehran has proposed a resolution to the UN atomic agency demanding a global ban on military attacks against nuclear installations, in response to unprovoked strikes by Israel and the United States on its facilities. Mohammad Eslami, who has left for Vienna to participate in the 69th General Conference of the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA), characterized the attack on Iran's peaceful nuclear facilities and the agency's lack of a position on this issue as an example of applying “a double standard.

items.title: Iran will honor IAEA deal only if Europe ditches snapback of sanctions: FM
items.summary: Iran will implement a recent agreement with the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) only if UN sanctions are not re-imposed on the country under the so-called snapback mechanism, Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi says. Iranian lawmaker Ebrahim Rezaei, who is the spokesperson for the Parliament’s National Security and Foreign Policy Committee, cited Araghchi as saying on Saturday following a meeting between the top diplomat and members of the committee.

items.title: Academic boycott against Israel
items.summary: In today’s show, we’ll be asking why the Zionist colony is funding an Islamic college in Haifa, that was occupied by Zionist settlers in 1948.

items.title: Together for Palestine
items.summary: In today’s show, we’ll investigate who’s behind the Together for Palestine concert, which will be staged at Wembley Arena on September 17. In our first report, Latifa Abouchakra takes a look at who’s involved, beyond the artists who’ll be performing there, and has some surprising revelations about a number of the behind-the-scenes individuals and organizations.

items.title: Cellebrite data grab?
items.summary: In today’s show, we’ll be disclosing how the Israeli security company, Cellebrite, has access to huge amounts of sensitve data from all over the world. Its technology is being widely used by govt agencies, and poses serious questions about privacy.

items.title: Infiltration as a Zionist strategy
items.summary: In today’s show, we’ll be revealing the way in which the Zionist regime has subverted public and private institutions to promote the interests of the Zionist colony. In our first report, Latifa Abouchakra, offers up some examples of their nefarious activities.

items.title: Did Epstein work for Israel?
items.summary: In today's show, we'll looking into the links between the infamous Jeffrey Epstein, President Donald Trump and Israel's foreign intelligence service, Mossad. In our first report, Latifa Abouchakra, connects some of the dots.

items.title: Attacking Francesca Albanese
items.summary: In today's show, we'll be examining the concerted effort being made to silence Francesca Albanese. She's the UN's special rapporteur for the West Bank and Gaza, who has been investigating the abuses being perpetrated by the Zionist entity against the Palestinian people.

items.title: Zionist war criminals in the UK
items.summary: In today's show, Palestine Declassified asks why the British-based Zionists are being allowed to host war criminals and the Israeli occupation forces and even raise money for them.

items.title: Blair for genocide
items.summary: This edition of Palestine Declassified exposes the role of former British prime minister, Tony Blair, and his institute in a grotesque plan to turn Gaza into what Donald Trump described as the Riviera of the Middle East.

items.title: Israeli spy and the banning of Palestine Action
items.summary: In today’s show, we will be examining who exactly is behind the British home secretary’s decision to proscribe the non-violent civil resistance campaign group Palestine Action as a “terrorist” organization.

items.title: Iran slams Sudan mosque attack, urges immediate halt to targeting civilians
items.summary: Iran's Foreign Ministry has condemned a recent drone attack against a mosque in the city of Al-Fashir, Sudan, which killed and injured scores of innocent Sudanese worshippers. In a statement released on Sunday, the ministry describes the attack as a “manifest violation of the rules of international humanitarian law.

items.title: Pezeshkian: Iran will never bow to excessive demands
items.summary: Iranian President Pezeshkian says Tehran can overcome any re-imposition of sanctions and will never surrender to excessive demands. Pezeshkian made the remarks on Saturday in an address to a ceremony honoring medalists from the 2025 international science Olympiads, after the United Nations Security Council voted against a draft resolution that would have permanently lifted sanctions linked to Iran’s nuclear program.

items.title: ‘Unlawful and provocative’: Iran condemns E3’s move to ‘snapback’ UN sanctions
items.summary: Iran has condemned as “unlawful, unjustified and provocative” the European attempt to restore United Nations sanctions under the so-called snapback mechanism. The reaction came after the UN Security Council on Friday voted against a draft resolution that would have permanently lifted sanctions linked to Iran’s nuclear program.

items.title: Russia, China can block enforcement of E3 'snapback' sanctions on Iran: Analyst
items.summary: China and Russia hold the ability to obstruct the enforcement of UN sanctions on Iran even if the “snapback” mechanism is formally triggered, according to international lawyer and foreign policy analyst Reza Nasri. Britain, France, and Germany (the E3) moved to restore sanctions through the snapback process, alleging Iran’s non-compliance with the 2015 nuclear deal (JCPOA).

items.title: Iran says UN Security Council damages diplomacy after voting against sanctions relief
items.summary: Iran’s envoy says the United Nations Security Council’s decision not to permanently lift sanctions on Iran undermines the world body, disrupts diplomacy and endangers the Non-Proliferation Treaty (NPT). Iran's ambassador and permanent representative to the United Nations, Amir Saeid Iravani made the remark on Friday after the 15-member Security Council voted against a resolution that sought to block the re-imposition of deep economic sanctions on Tehran over its peaceful nuclear program.

items.title: CIPI Director on European politics, sovereignty and foreign policy
items.summary: This is an interview with Paolo Raffone, Director of the CIPI Foundation in Brussels, about the EU’s lack of action against Israel.

items.title: Israel fears resistance captures as Gaza faces extermination
items.summary: This program covers Israel’s ongoing war of extermination in Gaza, its fear of resistance capturing occupation soldiers, and the escalation of attacks in the occupied West Bank.

items.title: True Promise: the big surprise
items.summary: On June 13th, as Iranian diplomats prepared for talks with the US in Muscat, Oman, the Israeli regime struck Iran unexpectedly. Assassinations, airstrikes and cyber attacks.

items.title: Trump's tariffs: Africa's opportunity!
items.summary: As the US closes doors, China is opening new ones and redefining Africa’s place in the world. There is talk of the continent turning Trump’s punitive tariffs into a new opportunity.

items.title: Europe snapback gamble
items.summary: E3 triggered the so-called snapback mechanism enshrined in the JCPOA while failing to abide by its own commitments. This as the UNSC fails to adopt a resolution that would have prevented the re-imposition of anti-Iran sanctions.

items.title: The malicious use of AI
items.summary: It is impossible to ignore or turn away from the development of digital technologies and phenomena such as Artificial Intelligence (AI), which can positively contribute to anti-imperialist, anti-Zionist, and anti-fascist causes, as well as assist in spreading facts and ideas related to sovereignty, independence, and popular projects for the benefit of the people.

items.title: A young activist determined to dismantle injustice
items.summary: There are activists who don't just challenge systems, they confront them head-on. They blur the lines between protest and provocation, pushing public discourse into uncomfortable but necessary territory.

items.title: Ayatollah Khamenei pardons, commutes sentences of number of convicts
items.summary: Leader of the Islamic Revolution Ayatollah Seyyed Ali Khamenei has pardoned or commuted the sentences of an unspecified number of Iranian prisoners on the eve of the birthday anniversary of Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him). Ayatollah Khamenei on Tuesday agreed to a request by Iran’s Judiciary chief Gholamhossein Mohseni-Ejei to pardon or reduce the sentences of a number of inmates eligible for parole or reduction of sentence.

items.title: Iran leads region in reproductive medicine publications: Health Ministry
items.summary: Iran’s Health Ministry states that the country has ranked first in West Asia in terms of the number of published articles and citations in reproductive medicine. Deputy Health Minister for Research and Technology Shahin Akhoundzadeh made the announcement on Wednesday at the opening ceremony of the 26th Royan International Congress and the 24th Festival at Shahid Beheshti University in Tehran.

items.title: Pezeshkian congratulates Iran’s astronomy Olympiad team on world championship win
items.summary: President Masoud Pezeshkian has congratulated the Iranian Astronomy Olympiad team for clinching the world championship title for the second consecutive year. The Iranian team secured the world championship at the 18th edition of the International Olympiad on Astronomy and Astrophysics (IOAA) in Mumbai, India, where over 300 high school students from 64 countries competed, by notching up a clean sweep of five prestigious gold medals.

items.title: Iran's police arrest over 80 major drug traffickers in five months
items.summary: The deputy chief of Iran's anti-narcotics police says more than 80 major drug traffickers have been arrested across the country over the past five months. Nosratollah Barin added on Sunday that 816 gangs engaged in the production and distribution of various drugs and psychoactive pills have been identified and dismantled since the beginning of the current Persian year (starting on March 21).

items.title: Over one million Iranians cross border into Iraq for Arba’een pilgrimage
items.summary: More than one million Iranians have crossed the Mehran border between Iran and Iraq in recent weeks for the Arba’een mourning ceremony, the governor of the western Ilam province says. Ahmad Karami said on Wednesday that since the beginning of the lunar calendar month of Safar (starting on July 26) to date, more than one million Iranian pilgrims have passed through the border crossing.

items.title: Western news outlets call on Israel to grant press access to Gaza
items.summary: Western news agencies have called on the Israeli regime to allow international journalists access to the Gaza Strip to report from the besieged Palestinian territory. Since October 7, 2023, journalists from international news agencies have been denied access to the besieged territory, only permitted to enter and exit Gaza under Israeli military escort and subject to strict reporting restrictions.

items.title: Israeli strike on church sheltering displaced Gazans may constitute war crime: UN Rights Office
items.summary: The United Nations Human Rights Office in Geneva has announced that the Israeli strike on a church in the Gaza Strip sheltering displaced Palestinians may constitute a war crime. The Holy Family Church, the only Catholic Church in Gaza, came under deadly Israeli attack on Thursday, leaving multiple casualties.

items.title: New Freedom Flotilla sets sail to break Israeli siege of Gaza
items.summary: A new Gaza-bound Freedom Flotilla ship with pro-Palestinian activists on board has set sail from the southern Italian port of Syracuse in Sicily. The Handala, operated by the non-violent Freedom Flotilla Coalition, with 15 pro-Palestinian activists on board, departed from the port at around 12:00 pm (1000 GMT) on Sunday.

items.title: Borrell urges EU to uphold international law by backing Francesca Albanese
items.summary: Josep Borrell, the former European Union foreign policy chief, has asked the EU to back the United Nations Special Rapporteur Francesca Albanese after the US unlawfully targeted the UN mandate holder with sanctions. On Wednesday, as part of Washington’s efforts to silence voices critical of the continuous US-Israeli genocidal war against Palestinians in the Gaza Strip, the United States State Department sanctioned Albanese, UN Special Rapporteur on the situation of human rights in the Palestinian territories.

items.title: Muslims hold mourning ceremonies to mark Ashura worldwide
items.summary: Millions of Muslims across the world are observing Ashura, which commemorates the martyrdom anniversary of Imam Hussein (AS), the third Shia Imam, and the grandson of Prophet Mohammad (Peace be upon Him). Ashura, the 10th day of the lunar month of Muharram, falls on Sunday in Iran this year.

items.title: Nearly 30 injured in magnitude 5 quake in northeast Iran
items.summary: A magnitude 5. 0 earthquake in Iran’s northeastern Khorasan Razavi province has rocked several cities, injuring more than two dozen people.

items.title: Iranian hospital uses angiography for brain vascular treatment without surgery
items.summary: An Iranian hospital has employed the cutting-edge angiography technology for brain vascular treatment, which obviates the need to open the skull, thus ensuring a safer and less invasive method to cure patients with brain vascular blockage. Baqiyatallah Hospital in the capital Tehran uses the latest angiography technology to treat vascular blockages in brain without the need for anesthesia or open surgery, Fars news agency reported.

items.title: Press TV Turkish, Hispan TV Brasil officially launched by IRIB World Service
items.summary: The Turkish-language service of Press TV and the Portuguese-language service of Hispan TV for Brazil were officially launched on Sunday, marking a significant expansion in global news coverage. Peyman Jebelli, the head of the Islamic Republic of Iran Broadcasting (IRIB), announced the unveiling of these two new services under the IRIB World Service umbrella at an event in Tehran.

items.title: The 3rd Sobh International Media Festival accepting entries until February 5
items.summary: The third edition of the Sobh International Media Festival – Iran’s prestigious international media event – is accepting entries worldwide until February 5, 2025. The Sobh International Media Festival was launched in 2023 by the World Service of the Islamic Republic of Iran Broadcasting (IRIB), the state broadcaster of the Islamic Republic.

items.title: Iran's national team shines at international AI Olympiad
items.summary: The Iranian national team achieved remarkable success at the inaugural International Olympiad in Artificial Intelligence, earning a bronze team medal and securing the 18th overall rank in Bulgaria. The team, comprised of students Mohammad Sadra Kouhestani, Amir Hossein Zarei, Parsa Sadeghi, and Alireza Rahimi Yazdi, showcased their skills in a highly competitive environment.

items.title: Leader hails election race as Iran gears up for presidential polls
items.summary: Leader of the Islamic Revolution Ayatollah Seyyed Ali Khamenei has hailed televised debates among presidential candidates ahead of Iran's June 28 election, saying they give people familiarity with the opinions of the six contenders. The Leader made the remarks on Saturday morning in a meeting with the country’s judicial officials, after Iranians watched overnight the third of five debates planned in the days before the vote to replace President Ehrahim Raeisi who lost his life in a helicopter crash.

items.title: Highlights: Second debate in 2024 Iran presidential election
items.summary: The second televised debate in the 2024 Iranian presidential election has commenced, with six contenders presenting their blueprints on the country's economic as well as social issues. This debate follows the first one held on Monday, which centered exclusively on the theme of the economy, covering important topics such as economic development plans, sanctions, inflation, foreign trade, and investments.

items.title: Iran’s president meets Leader before heading to New York
items.summary: Iran’s President Masoud Pezeshkian has met with Leader of the Islamic Revolution Ayatollah Seyyed Ali Khamenei before travelling to New York to attend the 80th United Nations General Assembly (UNGA) session. Pezeshkian briefed the Leader on the planning done for his trip during the meeting on Monday evening.

items.title: International Peace Day event in Tehran exposes MKO-Israel nexus in 12-day war
items.summary:
Farzaneh Ashoorioun

Press TV, Tehran

Marking the International Day of Peace, Iran has held a conference to honor the victims of terrorism; and to unveil new evidence showing the collaboration between the MKO terrorist organization and the Israeli regime during the recent war on Iran.

items.title: Iranian economy contracts 0.1% y/y in Q1 calendar year
items.summary: The Iranian economy contracted slightly in the first quarter of the calendar year that started in late March, according to figures by the Statistical Center of Iran (SCI). SCI figures published on Monday showed that Iran’s gross domestic product (GDP) had reached 24,270 trillion rials (over $23.

items.title: [Exclusive Photos] Rice harvesting in Kashmir
items.summary: Shafaqna English- Rice cultivation is an integral component of rich cultural heritage in Kashmir valley. The crop is grown on 100% irrigated ecology and melting snow is the source of irrigation.

items.title: Toxic Protein Punctures Brain Cells in Parkinson’s, Real-Time Study Reveals
items.summary: Shafaqna English- Scientists have directly observed a toxic protein drilling dynamic, pore-like holes into brain cells—a breakthrough that could reshape understanding of Parkinson’s disease. Using a novel high-resolution imaging platform, researchers from Aarhus University captured how α-synuclein oligomers, small but harmful clusters of protein, attach to and puncture neuronal membranes in real time.

items.title: Hind Rajab Foundation files complaint against Israeli soldier in Czech Republic
items.summary: The pro-Palestine advocacy organization Hind Rajab Foundation (HRF) has lodged a criminal complaint in the Czech Republic against an Israeli soldier on charges of committing war crimes and acts of genocide during the Tel Aviv regime’s ongoing military onslaught in the Gaza Strip. The HRF said in a statement on Monday that it submitted the complaint to a court in Prague against Roei Haimatan, a member of the Israeli military’s Givati Brigade.

items.title: US envoy defends Israel's Qatar attack, says Netanyahu 'will go anywhere, do anything'
items.summary:
A senior American diplomat defended the Israeli aggression against Qatar, a US ally, saying that Israel’s prime minister, Benjamin Netanyahu, only cares about the interests of the occupying entity and will “go anywhere and do anything. ”

Tom Barrack, the United States ambassador to Turkey and the special envoy for Syria, made the remarks in response to a question about the recent Israeli aggression against Doha, which targeted leaders of the Palestinian resistance movement Hamas.

items.title: Iran seals freestyle-Greco double in Zagreb
items.summary:
Press TV’s website can also be accessed at the following alternate addresses:

This double triumph has lifted national pride back home. Iranian wrestling made history in Zagreb, with freestyle and Greco-Roman teams crowned champions of the tournament for the first time.
